clinical_study.brief_title: Acoustic Liver Biopsy in Normals and in Patients With Cirrhosis Using Endoscopic Ultrasound
clinical_study.official_title: Acoustic Liver Biopsy in Normals and in Patients With Cirrhosis Using Endoscopic Ultrasound.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the amount of fibrosis in the liver of hepatitis C patients with advanced fibrosis, using endoscopic ultrasound.

detailed_description.textblock:
Background: Transabdominal ultrasound cannot be used to quantitate fibrosis in patients with cirrhosis due to variability in the abdominal wall thickness and composition. This variability can be eliminated by using endoscopic ultrasound.
Aim: To determine the amount of fibrosis in the liver of hepatitis C patients with advanced fibrosis, using endoscopic ultrasound.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once at the time of the endoscopic ultrasound

study_pop.textblock: Collect endoscopic ultrasound images form normal subjects, alcoholic liver patients and patients with hepatitis C Cirrhosis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- hepatic cirrhosis and hepatitis C and undergoing endoscopy
- Alcoholic liver and undergoing endoscopy
- Normal liver undergoing endoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- Children
